LanguageData.learnBycastingSpells: If using abilities give proficiency experiance.
LanguageData.CastProRequirement: If abilities have a proficiency requirement to cast.
LanguageData.strictMightCastReuRequirement: If might skills requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.strictMagicCastReuRequirement: If magic spells requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.CostScale: If ability costs scaled based on known proficiencies.
LanguageData.FailChanceReport: The chane for an individual to fail to discover a class or spell when using this.
LanguageData.ProficienciesMasterOffseter: If proficiencies enhanced stat modifier behaviour is enabled.
LanguageData.UnlearnProOnClassGain: If a pawn will unlearn proficiencies that they normally would not use when gaining a class.
LanguageData.LLARoM_LearnMagicMissingProficiencies: {0} is not able to understand that tome.
LanguageData.LLARoM_LearnMightMissingProficiencies: {0} is not able to understand that manual.
LanguageData.LLARoM_LearnSpellMissingProficiencies: {0} is not able to understand that scroll.
LanguageData.LLAROM_GemOfInsight: {USER_labelShort} used a gem of insight to learn {1}.
LanguageData.StrictMightClassLearning: If a might class requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.StrictMagicClassLearning: If a magic class requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.StrictSkillLearning: If a fighter skill requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.StrictSpellLearning: If a magic spell requires knowing proficiencies instead of being able to learn proficiencies.
LanguageData.ObscureCertianProficiencies: If magic and magic proficiencies are hidden if a pawn cannot learn them.
LanguageData.ObscureAllProficiencies: If all proficiencies are hidden if a pawn cannot learn them.
LanguageData.LLRoM: Life Lessons and A Rimworld of Magic Intergration
LanguageData.CanFailLearn: If there is a chance to fail an attempt to learn a class or an ability when self teaching, fail chace is determined by the object used.
LanguageData.LLRoM_AutoLearnClassFail: {0} failed to make a breakthrough, cause: random chance.
LanguageData.LLRoM_FailAutoLearnedClassNoClasses: {0} failed to make a breakthrough, cause: no possible breakthroughs.
LanguageData.LLRoM_FailAutoLearnedClassUnknownError: {0} failed to make a breakthrough, cause: unknown.
LanguageData.CanSelfTeachClasses: If a pawn can learn attempt to learn a class at certain spots.
LanguageData.CanOnlySelfTeachClasses: If classes can only be learned by interacting at certian spots.
LanguageData.CanSelfTeachSpells: If a pawn can attempt to learn a spell using a blank scroll.
LanguageData.CanOnlySelfSpells: If spells can only be learned by using a blank scroll.
LanguageData.CanSelfTeachSkills: If a pawn can attempt to learn a skill using a blank scroll.
LanguageData.CanOnlySelfSkills: If skills can only be learned by using a blank scroll.
LanguageData.LLROMNoFailedtoLearnSpell: {0} failed to teach themself a spell.
LanguageData.LLROMNoPossibleSpell: {0} already knows all the spells that they can learn.
LanguageData.LLROMNoFailedtoLearnSkill: {0} failed to teach themself a skill.
LanguageData.LLROMNoPossibleSkill: {0} already knows all the skills that they can learn.
LanguageData.StatOffseterLableDesc: These will apply once mastered, and will increase the base value by the listed offsets.
LanguageData.StatModiferLableDesc: These will apply once master, and will multiply by the listed percents.
LanguageData.ClassProLockout: If gaining a class will block learning proficiencies not normally useable by the class (detection based on Hediffs).
